alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Typhoon Watch issued May 20 at 4:54PM ChST until further notice by NWS Guam
info.description: ...TROPICAL DEPRESSION 02W NEWLY FORMED SOUTH OF POLOWAT... .NEW INFORMATION... None. .AREAS AFFECTED... This local statement provides important information and recommended actions for people in Guam, Rota Tinian and Saipan in the Mariana Islands, Satawal in Yap State and Ulul and Polowat in Chuuk State. .Watches/Warnings... A Tropical Storm Warning is in effect for the following locations, Ulul and Polowat in western Chuuk State and Satawal in eastern Yap State. A Typhoon watch is in effect for the following locations, Guam, Rota, Tinian, and Saipan in the Mariana Islands. .STORM INFORMATION... At 1 PM ChST...the center of Tropical Depression 02W was located near Latitude 5.6N...Longitude 149.0E. This was about 610 miles south-southeast of Guam. Storm Motion was north-northwest at 2 mph. Storm Intensity was 30 mph. .SITUATION OVERVIEW... It is vital that you do not focus on the exact forecast track. To do so could result in bad decisions and place you or those you are responsible for at greater risk. TD 02W has formed over western Chuuk State and is moving slowly north-northwest. 02W is forecast to become a tropical storm this evening and possibly a typhoon Sunday evening. It is too early to provide exact wind and surge forecast values for specific locations. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least extensive damage somewhere within the Mariana Islands. .PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... For those under a warning, preparations according to your typhoon disaster plan should be well under way or complete. Remain in shelter until the all clear is given by your local emergency management authority. For those under a watch, now is the time to begin preparing your home or business according to your typhoon disaster plan. Listen for possible warnings and be ready to evacuate if necessary. Heed the advice of local officials and comply with any orders that are issued. For interests at ports, docks and marinas, it is recommended that you perform the prescribed preparations according to your emergency operations plan for tropical cyclones. If you live on a boat, begin to safely secure your craft and make plans to leave it for adequate land-based shelter. Listen for possible warnings. Regarding the coastal waters under a watch, small craft should return to port or seek safe harbor. Closely monitor NOAA weather radio or other local news outlets for official storm information. Listen for possible changes to the forecast. For additional precautionary and preparedness information, please refer to the detailed recommendations relative to your location as further described by your local National Weather Service office and your local emergency management. && .NEXT UPDATE... The next local statement will be issued by the National Weather Service in Tiyan around 9 PM...or sooner if conditions warrant. ...Typhoon Watch remains in effect... ...New Information... None. ...PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Stay calm and keep informed. Comply with any evacuation orders that are issued for your area. If your home is vulnerable to high winds, or you live in a surge zone or any location prone to flooding, evacuate to a designated shelter or ride out the storm in the sturdy home of family or friends. Items to bring to a shelter include a first aid kit, medicines and prescriptions, baby food and diapers, games and books, toiletries, a battery powered radio, a cell phone, flashlights with extra batteries, a blanket or sleeping bag for each person, personal identification, copies of key papers such as insurance policies, available cash and credit cards. Remember, pets are not allowed in most public shelters, so check ahead with your intended shelter. Regarding your home or business, cover all windows and doors with shutters or plywood. Move patio furniture and other loose objects indoors. Brace all exterior doors, including garage doors. Do this as early as possible. If you need to make a trip to the hardware store, the grocery store, or the gas station, do so as early as possible. && ...Probability of tropical storm/typhoon conditions... The onset of tropical storm conditions could start as early as Monday afternoon, but are more likely Tuesday morning. ...Winds... As Tropical Depression 02W moves closer, the threat for sustained high winds is likely to increase. The latest forecast is for tropical storm force winds from Tuesday morning to late Wednesday evening. Tropical storm force winds are currently forecast to begin affecting the area early Tuesday evening. Strong Tropical Storm or Typhoon force winds are possible late Tuesday evening through Wednesday night. A general concern should be for the possibility of at least damaging winds somewhere within the area. ...Storm surge and storm tide... Dangerous surf conditions are possible Monday evening through at least Thursday. ...Inland flooding... Heavy rainfall is likely through most of the week. Rainfall amounts of 9 to 15 inches are possible with locally heavier amounts. Monitor conditions for possible flood watches, advisories or warnings.
